data.prayer: Spirit, help the 41,678 believers in Aklan to start simple multiplying churches in their homes.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Aklan, Philippines

data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Aklan to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 41,678 believers in the state of Aklan with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Father, move the 41,678 believers in the state of Aklan to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: Lord, I thank you that you will bring health and a cure to the Hanunoo people. Reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.
Father, please send new evangelists into the harvest in the state of Aklan, Philippines.
data.verse: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.prayer: Jesus, make the 230,490 people in the state of Aklan who claim to know you, brave enough to let the Bible weigh their thoughts and intentions today.
data.verse: For the word of God is living and powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

data.prayer: Father, for those with enemies and who are afraid in Aklan, call them into your shelter and safety today.
data.verse: For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.
